description: Enterprise techniques used by APT1, ATT&CK group G0006 v1.0
name: APT1 (G0006)

techniques.comment: [APT1](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0006) gathered a list of running processes on the system using tasklist /v.
[APT1](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0006) listed connected network shares.
[APT1](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0006) used the ipconfig /all command to gather network configuration information.
[APT1](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0006) used a batch script to perform a series of discovery techniques and saves it to a text file.
[APT1](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0006) used the commands net localgroup,net user, and net group to find accounts on the system.
[APT1](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0006) used the net use command to get a listing on network connections.
[APT1](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0006) used the commands net start and tasklist to get a listing of the services on the system.
[APT1](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0006) has collected files from a local victim.
[APT1](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0006) has used RAR to compress files before moving them outside of the victim network.
[APT1](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0006) has been known to use credential dumping.
[APT1](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0006) has used the Windows command shell to execute commands.
The [APT1](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0006) group is known to have used RDP during operations.
[APT1](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0006) has used batch scripting to automate execution of commands.
The file name AcroRD32.exe, a legitimate process name for Adobe's Acrobat Reader, was used by [APT1](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0006) as a name for malware.

[APT1](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0006) uses two utilities, GETMAIL and MAPIGET, to steal email. GETMAIL extracts emails from archived Outlook .pst files, and MAPIGET steals email still on Exchange servers that has not yet been archived.
The [APT1](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0006) group is known to have used pass the hash.

[APT1](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0006) hijacked FQDNs associated with legitimate websites hosted by hop points. Mandiant considers them to be “hijacked” since they were originally registered for a legitimate reason but are used by APT1 for malicious purposes.
[APT1](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0006) used publicly available privilege escalation tools.

techniques.techniqueName: Acquire and/or use 3rd party software services
techniques.comment: [APT1](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0006) used third party email services in the registration of whois records.

techniques.techniqueName: Compromise 3rd party infrastructure to support delivery
techniques.comment: [APT1](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0006) compromised a vast set of 3rd party victim hop points as part of their network infrastructure.

techniques.techniqueName: Compromise 3rd party infrastructure to support delivery
techniques.comment: [APT1](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0006) hijacked FQDNs associated with legitimate websites hosted by hop points. Mandiant considers them to be “hijacked” since they were originally registered for a legitimate reason but were used by APT1 for malicious purposes.
[APT1](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0006) used dynamic DNS to register hundreds of FQDNs.
